item.title: [IP-18906] Re-introduce a study just deleted might have some timing issue and be skipped
item.description:
while automating C296832, I need to delete a study and then re-send it back to the PACS, currently, I used this to delete study and check the study is gone (from dms side):

// delete the second study from the PACS
        final DicomModificationId dicomModificationId = mDicomMasterRequestApiClient.deleteStudyGlobal( secondSopIdentifiers.getStudyInstanceUid() );
        mPatientSearchApiClient.waitForStudy( secondSopIdentifiers.getStudyInstanceUid(), study -> !study.isPresent() );
        
        final DicomModificationStatus requestStatus = mDicomMasterRequestApiClient.getDicomModificationRequestStatus( dicomModificationId );
        
        assertTrue( requestStatus.getModificationStatus().equals( ModificationStatus.DONE ) );

however, when re-send the study back to the PACS and then check its existence, it always failed, I found that it was due to the fact that while although the dms done its study and delete request marked as done, the deletion is not really finished in lds yet while the IFW received the re-send study, so it found that the study still in DicomImage table, considered this as a duplicate and thus not to inserted.

Here is the study deletion request for the study:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
=>Correction id : [1-302-2-559] (internal request_id : [4322])
  STUDY_DELETION [DONE]
  study : [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
  timestamp : 1467127257650 (epoch in millis)
  timestamp UTC: Jun/28/2016 15:20:57.650 UTC
  timestamp Local: Jun/28/2016 11:20:57.650 EDT **

==>Attributes :
    (Unknown DICOM Tag)                         DoBackup             = [true]
    (Unknown DICOM Tag)                         RequestingUsername   = [radiologist]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

here is the actual deletion done in lds (based on LocalDicomService_DICOMMODIFICATION.log):

[2016-06-28 11:21:02.014 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Working on DicomModifications with StuInsUID = 2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941: 1-302-1-3760,1-302-1-3761,1-302-1-3762,1-302-1-3763,1-302-2-559
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.014 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] trying to acquire lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@1ebf667[Unlocked]] for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.014 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] got lock [java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock@1ebf667[Locked by thread DicomModification_0]]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.014 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: undoUncompletedCorrections (timer undoUncompletedCorrections)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.014 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Looking for undo data for corrections that failed mid processing
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.029 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.015 sec: undoUncompletedCorrections (timer undoUncompletedCorrections)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.029 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: CreateStudyData (timer CreateStudyData)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.030 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Handling normal scenario
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.031 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Setting SeriesOwner to EL4121
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.031 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Setting SeriesOwner to EL4121
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.031 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Creating Study Pending Global Transaction for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.032 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Finished Study Pending Global Transaction for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.032 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.003 sec: CreateStudyData (timer CreateStudyData)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.032 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: createUndoData (timer createUndoData)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.032 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Storing undo data to restore DicomImage state if necessary
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.033 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad] Serializing seriesLevel information for 2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067 with series owner EL4121
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.052 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.02 sec: createUndoData (timer createUndoData)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.052 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Doing series_version loading (and migration if needed) for series=[2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.052 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: AddSeriesVersionIfNeeded (timer AddSeriesVersionIfNeeded)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.053 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.001 sec: AddSeriesVersionIfNeeded (timer AddSeriesVersionIfNeeded)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.053 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: updateDicomImage (timer updateDicomImage)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.054 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Deleting all series for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.054 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Deleting the series [2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067] from SeriesLevel
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.055 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Setting SeriesOwner to EL4121
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.076 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.023 sec: updateDicomImage (timer updateDicomImage)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.077 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: updateFilesAndSeriesVersion (timer updateFilesAndSeriesVersion)
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.145 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Resetting any incoming_files entries for series=[2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067] that are in status [VERSION1, DICOMIMAGE, POSTRECEPTION] to status VERSION0
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.158 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Deleted validation_status row for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.158 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Removing study record for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941]
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.165 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Scheduled deferred activity with id=[5203]: DeferredActivityData{Type=UmdbSeriesDeleted, Data={StudyInstanceUid=2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941, AeTitle=EL4121, SeriesInstanceUid=2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067}}
[2016-06-28 11:21:02.165 DM_0 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Scheduled deferred activity with id=[5204]: DeferredActivityData{Type=RemoveAutoRoute, Data={SeriesInstanceUid=2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067}}

and here is the lds IFW log showing that lds considered the study as duplicate, you can see the time doing this is earlier than the time in LocalDicomService_DICOMMODIFICATION log:

[2016-06-28 11:20:58.459 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Processing 1 / 1 incoming files for status=PENDING
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.460 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: 2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067 (timer PENDING)
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.460 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Trying to mark 0 SOP(s) for cleanup
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.460 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.0 sec: 2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067 (timer PENDING)
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.461 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Processing 1 / 1 incoming files for status=IN_PROGRESS
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.461 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: 2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067 (timer IN_PROGRESS)
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.461 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] A study record for study [2.25.36463442819667988218135508265292225941] already exists. Bypassing DB insertion.
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.461 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] <-- Elapsed: 0.0 sec: 2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067 (timer IN_PROGRESS)
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.462 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] Processing 1 / 1 incoming files for status=VALIDATE
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.462 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (PROFILE)] --> Start: 2.25.75896060514737590980575237247468610067 (timer VALIDATE)
[2016-06-28 11:20:58.462 LDS_3 el4121.dyn.intelerad (TRACE)] DICOM-driven revalidation is disabled; duplicate SOPs will be discarded

If we have a way to access DicomImage table to make sure the study not exist before sending it, this wont happen (IP-18551). But since we have tried to access DB directly, that probably wont implement and discarded, I am opening this to make the issue in re-introduce aware. Currently, I am making some checkings of the first study in this case to workaround the issue.

Relevant changesets in this release:
intelepacs:73bb8fc9d131 pcabot PACS-4-14-1 IP-18816 ongoing: Re-enable TestSelfSignWorkflow

intelepacs:4b78627c50cf pcabot trunk IP-18816 fix: merge from PACS-4-14-2

Description of the solution:
TestSelfSignWorkflow has been re-enabled and splitted in two classes:

  • TestSelfSignWorkflow: tests the dictation and addendum self sign workflow
  • TestDictationReservation: tests a specific bug about reservation (IP-21694)

The self-sign workflow test has been re-written using the DictationWorkflowHighLevelDriver.
Note that the final report check is simply done by querying HL7GS (and not listening for an HL7 feed). Also, note that the final report check is done by expecting the value "F" in the OBX-11 field for both dictations and addendum (see IP-64867).

Also, dictation workflow related tests were regrouped under the "ivwl" package into specific sub-packages. Dictation related drivers were also moved there. This was done to facilitate the discovery of dictation workflow related tests and utilities.

Here is the new integration test package structure for ivwl:

integrationtesting.ivwl.workflow 
integrationtesting.ivwl.workflow.dictation
integrationtesting.ivwl.workflow.transcription
integrationtesting.ivwl.notes
integrationtesting.ivwl.scanneddoc

Because of that package structure change, the integration test whitelist (stored in IntegrationTestAnnotationValidatorImpl) has been adjusted with the new fully qualified names and old tests were removed from that list.

Tests executed:
Ran TestSelfSignWorkflow on 4.12.1 and trunk.

Integration tests added:
TestDictationReservation.java

This defect has been verified by the developer at the time of code change plus the execution of development testing. In addition, integration testing done by QA also verifies that this issue has been resolved.

In certain cases the deployment team during test farm creation will be the group responsible for verification during routine deployment testing.

Marking CLOSED.
Included in PACS-4-14-1-R6 (atlas 1.10.P10)
Included in PACS-4-13-1-R14 (atlas 1.9.P27)
Included in PACS-4-12-1-R28 (atlas 1.8.P75)

item.title: [IP-18744] Could not check some fields in ish file
item.description:
C6399, we need to check that in the ish file (nonImageSeriesHeader.ish in cdi folder), there is not value for field "IMSPOSTFIX", and C6400, we need to check that in the ish file, there is expected value for field "IMSPOSTFIX".

In the current framework, we use waitForConversion() in WaveletPollingImageConversionMonitor to check fields in ish file, for example, checking patiendId value there, we use something like this:

Predicate<SeriesHeader> predicate =
            seriesHeader -> expectedValue.equalsIgnoreCase( seriesHeader.getPatientId() );

        mImageConversionMonitor.waitForConversion( getSeriesInsUID( dicomObject ), predicate );

But SeriesHeader class does not seem to has the case for IMSPOSTFIX.

Those are not the only two cases, I might update while encountering more later.
item.summary: Could not check some fields in ish file

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Arthemas Nobrega, since you have recently did some work related to WaveletServer, perhaps you can take a look at this issue and see if it is already possible to check the contents of the series header file. Note that this is not about retrieving DICOM headers though.

Spent some time trying to understand why IntelePACS writes the IMSPOSTFIX element in seriesheader.ish files during image ingestion while there are no existing method for accessing it through the SeriesHeader objects. The only consumers of the seriesheader ish files are WaveletServer, InteleViewer and ImageRenderingService. The WaveletServer uses an optimized parser that only parse the subset of tags it needs and this does not include the IMSPOSTFIX. InteleViewer and ImageRenderingService parses the file through the XmlSeriesHeader class (implements the SeriesHeader interface) and access all fields through this interface. Therefore, no application is currently consuming the IMSPOSTFIX from the series header. This was curious and we decided to figure out why we were writing it in the first place since we are about to modify production code only for integration tests.

Turns out that the original intention was to write it to the series header file so that IV could strip it when required. When IV is connected to an IntelePACS and export DICOM data, it downloads the original DICOM header files through the wavelet server and does not use the series header ish. However, if you open a study through the WaveletServer, the cached DICOM files in IV's local storage are written from the series header content. The original intention, we believe, was to write the imspostfix from the series header into the local cache in case you would later try to export these cached studies while not connected to the PACS where they originally came from. In that case, IV cannot download the original DICOM headers and therefore exports what is in the local storage originally. However, it seems that we never did that part. So we are writting the postfix in the seriesheader so it can be stripped from the post-fixed accession number present in series headers, but we are not doing it so far.

After thinking about it, we decided it was fine to have integration tests verifying the contract of the series header file producer, but since there are no consumer of it, apart from the integration tests that we are about to write, we would do the change in prodcution code to give access to it, but only on trunk to minimize the risk. I suggest, as a general rule, that modifying production code on branch for the sole purpose of being able to write integration tests of features that existed for a long time (not a new feature-on-branch), should be avoided.

See reference documentation

item.title: [IP-18199] Update recipes for scanned document testing
item.description:
The integration testing recipes have to be updated in order to permit testing of the ScannedDocumentsApplication using the IntelePACS (DICOM) document source.

The necessary changes are:

  1. Add the configuration required for DMS and UMDB.
  2. Add the configuration needed by the Atlas ScannedDocumentApplication
item.summary: Update recipes for scanned document testing

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Note that a temporary recipe was created to test SDA configuration under IP-69449.
I talked to Mark Groves, he pointed out that there is sample configuration for DMS and UMDB in PACS.cfg.in.
